verbose_text: To determine in vivo whether the Rhbdf2 cub mutation (XREF_FIG A, loss of the cytosolic N-terminal domain of RHBDF2) phenocopies human tylosis, and whether the tylosis p.P189L mutation (XREF_FIG B, missense mutation in the cytosolic N-terminal domain of RHBDF2) in RHBDF2 increases AREG secretion, we generated mice carrying the human tylosis mutation p.P189L (p.P159L in mice) using CRISPR / Cas9 mediated targeting and homology directed repair in C57BL/6J zygotes (XREF_FIG C).
evidence: tylosis p.P189L mutation ( XREF_FIG B, missense mutation in the cytosolic N-terminal domain of RHBDF2) in RHBDF2 increases AREG
